text: Sampled on draft this beer poured a very dark brown color - almost black - with orange highlights and a medium sized foamy tan head that left decent lacing. The aroma was bacon and toasty malts. The flavor was sweetish, toasty and woody with notes of bacon and bread crust. Long finish. Medium body. Solid.
Enjoyed at BTBF 2017. Hazy brown color, tan head. Heavy smoke aroma! Deep smoke. Malts, Roast. Flavor is beefy smoke, roasted malts. Rauchbier for sure.
Bottle from Liquor Barn into a tulip. Aroma is roasted malt with a lot of smoke.
Bottled. Small sample. The aroma has roast, peat. Black coloured beer with a medium sized, beige head. The taste is moderate bitter, roasty with peat and bacon. Medium-full bodied beer. Nice.

tap @ tucson hop shop: I dont often rate beers with this many ratings but this is quite special. I have been fortunate enough to taste quite a few of the top 50 smoked from Germany, all of which were excellent examples of German Rauchbiere in their various forms. However, this Left Hand is quite a different beast. The nose could almost fool one into thinking that there is a German Bock with ample smoked malt hiding in the glass but with the addition of some charred wood. The taste, however, is quite different. This is very close some sweet stouts with maltose in its perceived sweetness but manages to carry over a lightness all the way into the finish which leaves me with a mix of caramel, charred wood, oak smoke and a general desire to go sit by a fire somewhere outside. This comes together very well for me but in a different way than expected.
Sampler at Growler USA. Dark brown. Intense smoke up front, then sweet malt taste and finish.

Black draft pour at Monks pub. Pretty damn smokey but good. Coffee and maybe some coffee - the smokey highlights this sucker.

Tap at Sedona. Pours black. Definite smoke in the nose, along with coffee. Flavor is smoke, ash, coffee, light chocolate. Bitter. For some reason I don't care for the initial taste up front, but thoroughly enjoy the back end. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

0.65l bottle from 2012 shared with The Tasting Crew. This one pours a really deep and dark brown colored body, on the border of being black actually and it has a medium sized quite rapidly fading brownish head. Love the aroma. Just so much bacon! Smoked bacon and beef with hints of pine, roasted malts and a little minty herbal hint. Nice! This is how I like my smoked porters. Not over the top smoky, not too sweet or too beefy. Really round and balanced this one! Gliding oily in the mouth and its soft and gentle on the carbonation. Theres a good amount of chocolate also in this one. Delish! 26.11.2014

Pours a deep brown to black with a light brown head. Aromas of malt and some caramel. Taste the smoke first. Then comes the malt and molasses. Nice smoked porter. Very complex flavor. Almost no hop taste. Light palate with lots of lacing in the glass. No alcohol burn.
Bottle poured dark cola brown with a small tan head and small lacing. Aromas of chocolate, mild smokiness, and coffee. Flavor is semisweet.
Bottle - The smoke is forward which mixes well with the base porter. Not my favorite, but solid all the same.

Bottle from Appalachian Vintner. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Nice smoke notes on the nose. Nice blend of smoky and roasted malt. Finished clean. Its a pretty nice beer.

Bottle from WOB. Dark brown with small amounts of head and lace. Vanilla, oak, roast, smoke and malt in the nose. Drink. Its sweet. Smoky and BBQish, toast and woods, vanilla malt balls and earthy hop. Interesting stuff but too dang sweet. It is super smooth. Could give it another shot. I cant drink overly sweet dark beers.

From the 650 ml bottle Vintage 2016 with a best by date of 10/14/21. Good for five years! Deep dark brown pour under a long lasting, foamy light brown head. Smoky malts and sweetness are notable in the aroma. A little charcoal and maybe some raisins. The body is medium to full with a slight astringency. What a wonderful taste with those smoked malts tickling my tongue and a bold somewhat dry finish. The bitterness does not linger but it is warming.

Treated as an imperial smoked porter, this was poured into a snifter.
The appearance was a dark brown close to black color with a thin white to off white foamy head that dissipated at a good pace. Mild lacing builds around the rims nicely and adequately.
The aroma takes on the normal qualities of a smoked porter: some meatiness (maybe ham/bacon) and then theres some salt, did they do this intentional? Me, I dont mind, but have to admit, thats a bit different.
The flavor yields to the sweet to smoky meatiness flowing over a sly earthy/bitter hoppiness. Saltiness comes back slyly. Decent flowing meaty sweet sly stickiness flowing over my tongue, sly subtleties.
Overall, a very nice imperial smoked porter that I would love to have again, but not comparable to De Molens Bloed, Zweet & Tranen or Alaskans Smoked Porter. Dont get me wrong, its good, but just not up there.
The smell is hickory, molasses, sweet, the look is a very dark brown, almost a bbq brown. The taste is like drinking BBQ!!!! This is an incredible beer if you love smoked, hickory

22 oz bottle shared, purchased at Hy Vee Wine & Spirits - Muscatine. Black appearance with a light brown head. Aroma of smoked malts, roasted grain, light chocolate and hints of coffee. Similar flavor, adding moderate bitterness and mild sweetness. Medium to full body with a lingering smoky finish. Nice.

Aroma - has a mix of iron, peat, barley, beechwood smoke, char, jerky meatiness, and slight very subdued herbal nature.
Appearance - the body is black, and the head is around 2" and khaki in color. The head hangs around for a while. There is good wispy lacing.
Taste - is rich with big, but pleasant smoke. The smoke is similar to what you would get out of fine German Rauchbiers. Im assuming the smoke comes from a fine beechwood smoked malt - the subtle notes of that malt beneath the smoke appear to have some molasses, barley, and some herbs. Overall you get smoke, peat, a slight meatiness (a smoked county sausage), molasses, and a slight roast.
Palate - body is approaching the full mark, texture is somewhat creamy and thick, the carbonation is average, and the finish smoky, meaty, and the faintest touch astringent.

Bomber from Total Wine in Chantilly, VA
Aroma: smoke, roasty, molasses, chocolate, earthy
Appearance: deep brown with a tan head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent

The aroma is coffee, some smoke, malty. Pours almost black, with light brown head, fully diminishing and very good lacing. The taste is smokey bitter. The body is medium, the texture creamy, the carbonation lively and the finish bitter. Very good!!

On tap at SLL tasting. Pours a very dark brown, almost black with thin tan head. Very smokey smell, with sweet malts. Very balanced taste, smokey, smooth, toasted malts, molasses, slightly bitter finish, with a smokiness lingering. Mouthfeel is full bodied, thick and silky
Pours dark brown to black with a diminishing brown lacing. Aroma is smoke and burnt chocolate. Taste is smooth coffee and chocolate with smokiness. Very nice!

Dark brown color. Peat aromas, smoke, coffe and cacao. Really well balanced taste with smoke, roasted malt and chocolate. Medium bitter finish with wood and lingering smoke. Tried a second time thanks to Xebbe.

Bomber, 2014 vintage. Smokey aroma with notes of chocolate and roasted malt. Pours deep brown with a thin light brown head with poor retention and very little lacing. Starts with sweet chocolate and roasted malt flavors that has a rich, chewy mouthfeel. Finishes impeccably smooth with excellent smoke flavor wafting through the initial flavors to linger nicely on the palate. Well balanced and by far the best smoked beer I've had so far.

Pours a deep dark brown with a small reddish brown head. Aromas of liquid smoke, sardines, and firewood. Flavors of chocolate, espresso, and smoke. Nice dry crisp finish. Smokey aftertaste stays with you for awhile.

January 29, 2016. Bottle, vintage 2014. 
Black with a small, dense brown head. Aroma is smoked wood, charcuteries, roasted malts, chocolate, some licorice, coffee and caramel. 
Taste is medium sweet, light roasted and smokey and medium bitter. 
Finish is medium sweet, medium bitter with some smoked charcuteries, earthy herbal notes, hints of coffee and chocolate. Medium to full bodied, smooth, soft carbonation. 
Very nice imperial porter with a well balanced smokiness.

650ml bottle. Darkest brown. Short tan head. Aroma has chocolate maltiness, brown sugar, hops and a restrained smokiness. Taste adds sticky molasses and coffee bean notes. Not too sweet. Smokiness is much less than I expected throughout but still a very good porter.

Smells like a burning forest.. Black..nice taste of smoke but much mor..
A very nice beer

Poured jet black with off white head. Aroma is of smoked bacon. Very smokey aroma. Very inviting. Flavour is of smoke ham, salt, raisins, slight chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Nice bitter finish. Great beer

Bomber bought @ Systembolaget. Pours blackish dark brown with a creamy mocha head that doesnt leave much trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is sweet, malty, smokey and boozy with roasted malts, caramel, dark roast coffee, fried banana with chocolate and vanilla ice cream, smoked ham, minerals and alcohol. Taste is sweet, bitter, malty, smokey and slightly boozy. Mouthfeel is round, slightly viscous, tiny roasted astringent, boozy and medium to full bodied. Finish is sweet and bitter with roasted malts, caramel, dark chocolate, coffee, smoked ham, burnt wood, minerals, alcohol and hints of fried banana. Very well integrated smoke on a solid slightly banana estery imperial porter. Bit hot but it suits the beer and drinking experience. I like it!

Black beer with a one finger, beige, head. 

Nose: Chocolate, smoke, cocoa, coffee, rasted malt, brown sugar and hops. 
Taste: Rasted malt, smoaked roasted malt, oak, vanilla, brown sugar, black pepper, coffee, molasses and dried fruit. 
Body: Full body with light carbonation. Complex structure. Smooth and creamy. 

Great Imperial Porter!

Bottle shared at the Cotteridge convention, 24/01/2015. Thanks to Garrold. Dark black / brown coloured pour with a lasting light tan head. Aroma is smoked ham, honey glaze,dark choccuy, smokey phenols. Flavour is composed of smoked ham, cured meat, phenols, choc, bit of berry in the finsh. Palate is semi-sweet. Tasty.

Pours black with khaki head. Charcuterie scents, spent matches, chocolate malts, wet paper. Smells like a Bamberg Rauchbier but with a lot more malty body, pretty awesome. Medium bodied palate, medium bitterness. Loads of complexity. Very long finish with incredible balance. Some sweetness, bitterness, hints of acidity. Very good.

650ml bottle at the Hoopy Pub, Thessaloniki, courtesy of Konstantinos. Black color with beige head. Aroma is smoked-peated with leather notes and roasted malty with milk chocolate to dominate. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

How: Bottle.
Where: Systembolaget.
Appearance: Black colour with a beige head.
Aroma: Roasted malt, wood, liquorice, smoke, chocolate.
Body: Full body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Smoke, wood, liquorice, peat, chocolate.

Bottle thanks to Homer! Pours dark black, small tan head, dissipates fairly quickly, decent lacing. Aroma is smokey for sure, campfires, ashes, roasted malts. Medium sweet, light plus smoky, lightly bitter. Notes of roasted malt, ash, wood fire, and cocoa. Medium body, low acidity. Well integrated and definitely not meaty. +1
Bottle. Pours pitch black with a small head. Very thick texture. Rich flavour and aroma of roasted malts and smokiness. Very good, rich, pleasant beer.
Bottle cotteridge pissup. Black thin head. Great smokey bacon aroma taste same lots of smoke pest dark fruits and malts. Ok body. Very good.

Bottle split at the Cotteridge Convention, thanks to Garrold, 24/01/15.
Light black with a decent tan covering.
Nose is liqourice, sice, light smoke, treacle toffee, dark maltings.
Taste comprises dark berry fruit, more liqourice stick, light smoked malt, faint cocoa, toffee.
Medium+ body, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Ok offering but perhaps falls a little short on deliverance when considering the ABV. Id proably have this down as an imperial porter over smoked style wise, pretty subtle rauschings.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle share at Cotteridge Convention 24/1/15
Poured a black colour with tan head of decent proportion,
Aroma of smoke and coffee, Taste of Coffee, Chocolate, Toffee, Cocoa, oly texture, all smoked in., I quite liked this!!

Bottle at the Cotteridge Convention thanks to Garrold. It pours dark brown with a small white head. The nose is liquorice, umami, salted caramel, earth and smoke. The taste is bitter, rich roast, cocoa, salted caramel, umami, oily, burnt wood, earth, light spice and mild smoke. Medium+ body and moderate carbonation. Smooth. Decent enough, but it didnt wow me.

Bottle share at Cotteridge Wines. Black, very little head. Aroma is, as expected, smokey. Body is medium, low carbonation, smooth. Taste is light malt, semisweet toffee, smokey salty bacon, light bitterness. Decent.

24th Jan 2015: Bottle shared at the Cotteridge Wine meet. Poured a dark, deep brown with a cream coloured head. Smoke is the name of the game here, it rules the roost in everything about this brew. Fancy tasting and smelling a dark chocolate covered smoked ham hock rolled in gravel? Well thats what this beer is like! Nice and different if you like smoky beers that is, which I dont.
Bottle share. Cotteridge Beano. Clear brown. Film of tan head. Light, savoury smoke. Light fruit. Smooth, rich, and fruity. Dry, light bitter finish. Decent.

Bottle shared at the Cotteridge Convention 2014. Thanks! Pours deep brown with a creamy, tan head. Good smoke in the snout, accented with chocolate and earth. Medium sweet flavor with rich smoked malts, earthy bitterness, baking cocoa. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Lingering smoke in the finish, more dark chocolate, balancing scorched earth bitterness. Solid.
660ml bottle. Pours very dark brown with a small head. Aroma is smoky ham. Taste has light smoky ham. Touch of charcoal and coffee.

Bottle. Pours jet black with a thick tan head. Aroma of chocolate, smoke, roasted malts and coffee. Flavor of dark chocolate, coffee, dark roasted malts, notes of campfire and some smoked meats. Creamy smooth texture, medium-plus body, soft carbonation.

Bottle. Black. Smoky beechwood, bbq jerky, slight salty chocolate malts. Full bodied, smooth nice texture. Sweets, but with the bitters for balance. Sweet milky chocolate, smoky malts in flavour. Really nice smoked porter. Like the sweetness, chocolate, and how it mixes with the relatively strong smoke.-- bb

Pours black with thick tan head. Aromas are really smokey, smoked meats, with dark malt roastiness. Nice thick mouthfeel, mild sweetness balanced by bitterness from dark malts and smoke. Not too heavy, but full flavored quite nice.

Bottle from old notes. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small off white head. The aroma has a bunch of meaty, savory smoke character with some toasted malt, chocolate and molasses. The flavor is much of the same; big meaty smoked character, chocolate, molasses, toasted malt and some earthy bitterness to the finish, one of their better beers.

22 oz Bottle. Tasted on 12/17/14. Beer courtesy of Chae. Bottle date 2/17/12. The aroma on this was almost that of opening a bottle of liquid smoke. I know it is a smoked porter but it was too much smoke flavor & aroma & not enough of the porter itself to me. I was not feeling this one very much. As the beer warmed toward the end of the bottle the smoke mellowed & it was much better. Overall I wouldn't get again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark and cloudy with a whisp of tan head. Aroma of camp fire, toasted marshmallow, and burnt molasses. Taste is bitter smokey malt with caramel and toffee mixed with a forest fire. Nice smoked offering.

Smokey aroma with leather, cocoa, cashew nuts and vanilla. Taste is smokey and with sweet malty beginning and balanced of with a nice dark chocolatey bitterness in end and finish. Nice balanced smoke porter where the smoke is balanced and not overtakes the entire beer.

On draft at el bait shop in des moines. Most smoked beers either a) are overly smokey without much else going on, or b) posses so little smoke that the beer shouldnt be touted as smoked at all. This beer does a great job of finding the elusive middle ground. Plenty of smoke, but its set against a real beer. Best thing Ive had from left hand.

22oz bottle ~2 yrs old.
APPEARANCE  perfect black beer, light tan head with good lacing.
NOSE - very good smoke / malty balance.
FLAVOR - excellent smokey porter! Perfect balance of smoke and porter flavor.
NOTES - It takes a bold beer to live up to the label.... and this does.

26.11.2014, 0,65l bottle sampled @ BBGTC tasting:
Nice light brown creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly rich and smoked, dark malts, smoked bacon crisps, caramel, licorice, grass, chocolate pudding. Taste is slightly rich, dark malts, licorice, paper, medicine, sour coffee, smoke, grass. Medium bitterness, slightly harsh medical mouthfeel. Nice enough.

Bottle(d) 02/07/12 Pours a dark brown looking black in the glass. Creamy tan head. Aroma is heavy smoke, like smoked meat/bacon, notes of ham and roasted malts. Also some coffe. Taste is very well balanced. Smokey notes blend well with nutty and roasted malts. Hints of chocolate and coffee. Close to full bodied with soft to avg co2 levels. A little warming. Pretty awesome.

Bottle, shared with BBGTC. Pours a jet black body with a small beige head. Nose is bacon crisp, chocolate, juniper wood, herbal tones, caramel, pork rinds, hints of licorice and coffee. Taste is dark chocolate and milk chocolate, smoke, brown sugar, ashes, licorice, hints of caramel, brown bread and coffee. Full body, medium carbonation. Lovely balanced smoked porter, a real treat.
Pours dark brown with a small tan head. Aroma and taste of smoked, sweet malt, campfire smoke and beef jerky. Well balanced smokiness behind the chocolate and roasted malt tones.

Pours black with a fairly large frothy light brown head. Aromas of chocolate, coffee, smoked bacon, tar, brown sugar. Taste is chocolate, coffee, slight roasted malty notes, smoked bacon, slight liqourice and vanilla notes. Mouthfeel is smooth and velvety with medium carbonation. Very well balanced with the smoky notes quite well integrated.

BBD 3/24/19. Yes, the stamp says 2019. Pitch black pour with an average head, below average retention and above average lacing. The nose is charred oak like smoke over a rich caramel sweetness with hints of dark fruit and chocolate. As it warms, light alcohol notes are noted and chocolate becomes more prevalent. Almost full bodied with a very rich creamy texture. Below normal carbonation with almost no effervescence in the finish. The World Class flavor profile is intense, yet masterfully balanced between smoke, caramel sweetness and mild bitterness. It is quite complex from the middle to the finish. It begins with a rush of oak like, rather than bacon such as in the Aecht Schlenkerla Rauchbiers, smoke with a rough charred nature - just like a Smoke Jumper would encounter - that coats the tongue in an oily onslaught. The sweet caramel background, with hints of vanilla and heavy chocolate notes, melds with it and slowly the bitterness and roast characteristics emerge. The exceptional finish is a blending of all previous flavors and the dark fruit characteristics finally get a chance to emerge against a rich chocolate background. As it warms, the vanilla component becomes quite evident in the finish. As everything fades, a nice residual smokiness sweetly coats the tongue and a low level alcohol burn tickles the back of the throat. Truly a World Class offering from Left Hand and the most flavorful smoked porter Ive ever had the privilege to drink.

Had it Out of the bottle. Nice one finger toffee colored head. Very dark. Has a nice aroma of smoke, peat, and coffee. Tastes of charred wood and dark roast coffee. Very palatable leaves a lingering smoke taste. Reminds me of sitting next to a bonfire. Paired well with blackened tuna steaks.

Bottle from systembolaget. Smell is heavy smoke, some beef jerky and bacon, campfire and a little hint chocolates. Pours black with a small brown head. Taste is smokey and dark with some roasted malts. Palate is surprisingly fresh and a little oily. Overall one of the better smoked beers Ive had. Worth a try.

Smokejumper left hand
Served 55 in a goblet
8.8% ABV
2014 bottle

Aroma:bottle smells like dark colored smoke, phenol is very heavy smelling of burnt coffee and mild nutty chocolate with a slight hidden hint of caramel, esters in the hops come through as a grassy/wet hay. Smoke overwhelms but a hint of vanilla gets through.

Appearance:Hops, wheat, barley, yeast
Pitch black, caramel head with heavy lacing, next to no carbonation. Poured hard with huge head, settles down to very little head (less than half a finger).

Taste: Very malty taste, molasses taste sits heavy in your mouth along with the coffee on the sides of the tongue. Evolves to licorice and toffee

Palate:incredibly smooth, lighter than expected for its strong aroma, and a bit creamy. Medium high longevity. Slight change from creamy to oily feel after swallow. Feint bitter hop I found appealing as it is present in the middle of your tongue rather than the "sour" bitter on the tip of the tongue. Medium body with subtle carbonation. Alcohol is balanced - satisfying warmth and smooth.

O: True to style. Super heavy on the smoke. Would have liked to get a more distinct aroma or taste of the yeast (Earthy) but the smokey malt is just so overwhelming(ly delicious).
Pours a dark brown with a medium tan foam head. Aroma is smoke and roast. Flavor is the same. Very well-balanced and delicious.

Strong smoke aroma from the start. Stays with you through the taste and palate. Make sure you let the temperature come up if your bringing it from the fridge. It is better at 55-60 degrees.

Smoky odor. Very smoky flavor but feel some dark berries, coffee and soy too. Heavy bitterness that fills the mouth forever. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of rich smoke, german sausage, light chocolate and coffee, but yeah, smoked sausage and smoke... Taste is very balanced chocolate and vanilla sweet initially followed by balanced smoky coffee bitter finish. Quite nice. Body is medium, creamy and smooth with soft carbonation.

650 ml bottle from web SB cons 2014-09-26 Göteborg
AR: heavy smoke - burned wood, tar, peaty, sweet dark chocolate, liqurice
AP: dark brown, wee stouthy dark brown head
F: heavy tar, rough smokey - burned wood, whiskey peaty, sweet liqurice, dark bitter chocolate, coffey, big body, long and lasting flavour, - cellering needed, its a bit rough...
Just love this! Its like biting an old boat...I feel like a pirate. Very pleasent smoke and tar taste and aroma.
Sweet smokey aroma, very soft carbonation, smokey with an inch of bitterness in the taste. straightforward beer with smooth smokeyness.

650ml brown bottle, with a cool label depicting a smokejumper, poured into a snifter glass. Appearance is opaque brownish black with a medium-small thick tan head. Aroma of milk chocolate, roasted malts, vanilla and smoked ham. Flavours of milk chocolate, vanilla, roasted malts and coffee. Taste is light-medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is full bodied, creamy texture and soft carbonation. Overall a delicious well balanced beer with a very pleasant smoke and chocolate aroma.
650 ml bottle from systembolaget bs. Pours black with little beige head. Very smokey aroma with sweet coffee taste. Quite nice but the smokiness is abit to strong in the end.
650 ml på flaska, doften är väldigt rökig och sött smaken är lite mildare och mer karamellig
650ml bottle. Deep brown body with a large tan head. A nice balance between roasted malt, chocolate and campfire.
Awesome aroma of chocolate, roast, smoke and all perfectly well balanced. The flavor characteristics are equally as good a blanced. Aperfect brewe.

on tap @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Opaque black, good rim head, swirls of lace. Taste is solid, mainline malt that adds just a wisp of smoke in the palate, then a bit of hops comes along as it moves effortlessly to a lingering finish. Chewy, understated, really satisfying to drink.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 3/24/2014. Pours fairly pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass. Aromas of big chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, wood smoke, toast, molasses, light char, light dark fruits, herbal hops, and roast/smoke earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roast/smoked malt moderate earthy hop notes; with good strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, toast, molasses, wood smoke, light char, light dark fruit, herbal hops, and roast/smokey earthiness. Fair amount of herbal/roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, toast, molasses, wood smoke, light char, light dark fruit, herbal hop, and roast/smokey earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice balance, complexity, and robustness of dark/roast/smoked malt and moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth and moderately creamy/chalky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent imperial smoked porter! All around great complexity and balance of dark/roast/smoked malt and moderate earthy hop flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Transfer from BA review on 9-12-12-
 Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

 Appearance  Served a deep brown colored brew with a small tan head. The head faded relatively fast to leave a light amount of lacing.

 Smell  The aroma is heaviest of chocolate and smoke. Other aromas of coffee, caramel, char, and some dark fruit mix with the former to produce a quite nice smell.

 Taste  The taste begins of roasted malt, dark chocolate, and coffee. Some sweeter flavors of the dark fruit and the caramel that were detected in the nose then start to enter the taste. While these sweeten the flavor in the middle of the taste, a smokiness soon starts to come to the tongue. With the arrival of the smoky flavors the sweet flavors seem to fade and the roasted flavors seem to intensity. This coupled with some char and burnt tastes coming to the tongue, along with a light alcohol taste, overall create a very roasted and warming taste to linger on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the just above average in thickness with a carbonation level that is on the lower side. The thicker and creamier body is wonderful for the dark and smoke flavors and complemented well by the warming alcohol taste. 

 Overall  Quite delicious. It has a nice semi- sweet and smoky porter and one to give a try 
if you have a chance.
Bottle split pour. Pours coffee black with a nice, super smokey aroma. Wow. Incredible beer. Full of smoked flavor with a nice chocolate background. Very impressed. Memorable. Solid beer. Loved it.
Tap. black and almost flat. Meaty flavor of chocolate, soy sauce, smoke. rich and tasty, though not hugely smoked.

Draft at the Hanshin Seed Event. Black pour tan head. First impression: bacon. Then more of a honeyed ham the second time around. Smooth mouthfeel, the flavor is solid smoked ham & mesquite. Good stuff.
Excellent smokey porter. Rich, hairy and full. A tad short on the finish, but otherwise top notch. Better than the Alaskan smoked IMHO.
Bottle shared by jheath99. Aroma of booze, molasses, and hops. Taste of smoke, molasses and bitter hops. Tangy aftertaste with sweetness at the back end. Very good

Bomber into a pint glass. Pours a deep brown, with a moderate tan head that fades gradually and leaves good lacing. Nose is molasses and smoke. Taste is smooth, with dark malt and smoke flavors. Very nice moderate length finish. Gets more complex as it warms. An outstanding smoked porter, nearly as good as Stones.

Location: Bottle shared by jcos split with dbarnold and Pinsky, 5/25/14


Aroma: This beer has a really nice smoky and malty aroma to it

Appearance: The pour is a dark brown color with a smallish tan head and light lace

Flavor: The flavor is smoky and a little sweet, with some nice balancing hops

Palate:The body is medium, it has a clean, almost dry finish on the mouth 

Overall Impression: 
Id be meaning to try this for a while, as I had always heard it is one of the better examples of the style out there. Plenty of smoke and meat flavors.    It did not disappoint, This is a really nice one.
Aroma of roasted malts, smoked meat, some chocolate. Favour is roasty, smoked. Smooth and easily drinkable.
Big smoke, big backbone, dry-ish, balanced, with some caramel and chocolate. excellent. Very rounded. Nice.

22oz bottle - pours jet black with dark mocha head . Roasted cocoa and smoked peat aromas . Taste is smooth chocolate and nice smoked malt . Silky finish . Very good .

Bottle. Pours dark brown with medium tan head. Settles in minutes with minimal lace. Aroma is sweet smoke, beechwood, smoked meat. Flavor is smoky, roasted, toasty, caramel with a lingering smoky finish. Soft carbonation, medium body and smooth texture. On of the better American smoke beers but nothing groundbreaking, porter character is mostly overwhelmed by smokiness.

Bomber into Le Guinness - nose is smoky. Savoring every second of this. Roast and almost vanilla. Dry. Next time I move some rope from Longmont to a guy named Gomez, this is what Ill be drinking. He better have my jewels or hes getting a tennis racket to the face after I stomp on him with my cleats. LPC for the win!

Draft at Maxs. Pours black-brown with a fizzy tan head. Tastes like smoked meat, very ashy, earthy, bitter. Light/medium body and low carbonation. Smells like strong smoke, light ash, smoked meat, earth.

Tap at Maxs. Pours opaque black with creamy beige head. Aroma is pork, roasted malts, peat, light earthiness, and faint dark fruit notes. Flavor is roast malts forward, espresso, dark chocolate, smoked meat, and some earthy bitterness; smoky finish. Medium/full body and medium carbonation.

Pours a pitch black beer with a good tan head. Smells chocolate, vanilla roasted. Tastes chocolate, roasted and vanilla. Not really smoked. Average carbo, medium body and a sticky texture.

Botella de 65 cl en el lúpulo en noviembre de 2013. Sabores de maltas tostados y ahumados bastante notables y bien combinados. Cuerpo medio de 8.8 vol y con buen paso por boca. Bastante buena y para repetir unas cuantas veces mas sin dudarlo.

Pours a black-brown color with a smallish tan head that soon reduces to a a partial top coat and a sizable, durable, bubbly ring. Some spotty lacing. The aroma is more delicate than expected: a light smokiness over dark chocolate with undertones of molasses and dark fruity. The taste starts rather pleasantly sweet but ultimately proves to be well-balanced in the sweet-bitter dimension, with negligible sourness. Chocolate flavor with subtle hints of molasses and prunes. The smoke is barely noticeable up front, but gently caresses the mid-palate and becomes more obvious in the finish. Smokey, mocha flavors linger for a good while afterwards. Full-bodied; smooth; excellent medium-low carbonation. 

O: I approach smoked beers with some trepidation since I find many of them to be too smokey and, therefore, too 1-dimensional. However, I have learned that there are excellent smoked beers, and this is one of them. Lefthand has crafted a beer that judiciously blends the sweetness of dark malts with a touch of hops and the smoke to brew a world-class porter. The ABV is so well hidden that I forgot about it altogether.

65cl, no mention of ABV, American brew, from Biernavigatie Webshop, complex smoked Porter, roasted/bitter and slightly smoked/fruity, not too heavy, balanced, hazy, good head, good brew, yet expensive!

Dark bodied, deep brown and a tan lace. Smoke, fennel, nutmeg and nutty malts. Quite a flavourful brew, lots of bitterness and sweetness that balance each other. Lively mouth feel, some alcohol. Roasted feel to this one. Would pare great with food. Nice! (Bomber from De Bierwinkel Leiden)

A bold black pour with a thin beige head. An instant aroma of smoke and chocolate hit your nose. The tast is dark chocolates, dark smoked roasted malts and maybe a hint of peat.

Intensiver Malzantrunk mit passender Süße. Rauchige Noten sind eher subtil, kommen insgesamt aber gut zur Gektung. Harmonisch und sehr intensiv, Nussschokoladig, leicht herb, dazu vergoren fruchtig. Die hohe Malzdichte bleibt voirhanden. 12/13/13/13/11/13
very dark brown with a small, tan head. Smokey with hoppy notes. Malt, smoke and hops. Medium to full body with a dry aftertaste.

11 Jan 2011, bottle. black w/ big head. smoked sausage nost but muted. nowhere near as big as Schlenkerla. thin/med body and slightly fizzy. i like this better than Schlenkerla. a little sweeter and not as heavy.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a very dark brown color with a light white head and not really any lacing. The nose brings some smoke along with a bit of roasted malt and some coffee. The smoke is quite nice. The taste is a bit different as I really cant get my head around everything thats going on here. Some smoke and roast plus some coffee and a bit of alcohol. A bit too much that doesnt quite meld. The smoke leads to a nice feel and this ends up drinking pretty well, though there was just something in the taste that didnt quite work for me.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010

750mL corked and caged bottle, from 2006.  Pours dark, dark brown, with slight garnet hues peeking through along the edges, topped with a creamy 2-finger latte-colored head.  The aromas are smoky and roasty cocoa, a little lactose, and caramel/molasses.  The flavor is roasted cocoa and milk chocolate, slight raspberry, vanilla, and toffee/caramel.  This moves to a slightly bitter espresso, cocoa, and smoke finish, with some lactose evident as it warms.  The smoke notes here complement and enhance the other flavors.  The mouthfeel is creamy; this beer has low carbonation, is full-bodied, and the alcohol is well-hidden.  This is crazy smooth, and quite complex.  Very good!

22 oz. bottle from Starrs Market.  Pours a dark, hazy brown color with a small tan head.  Aroma of smoked meats and hickory, earth, chocolate, roast, and toast.  Flavor of smoked hickory and pork, chocolate, coffee, and earth.  Medium-bodied, with moderate carbonation and a mellow smoky mouthfeel.  Not a whole lot to say about this one except that it is such a well-done smoked beer, and the smoke is pretty mild.  Pleasant surprise of the night.
Bottle at home ... smokey woody .... seeweed saltyness... thin tan head ... soft fruity sweet toffee malts ... light roast ... quite juicy fruits ... again a quite big smokeyness.

bottle: delicious beer for NYE brunch. Dark, black pour. arouma is syrup and toffee. dark malts, smoke and roast. Slight earthy hoppiness with candy sweetness. Finishes with a nice carbonic sour booziness. tasty.

[bottle]
Smoked ham aroma with some roasted barley bubblegum, faint vanilla, and detectable hops. Thick, oily black with a lacy brown patch and ring on top. Excellent chocolate and mocha flavour with some smoked ham and lost sof chocolate. Some pleasant ethanol playing off the black malt bitterness. Medium to full body, moderate to medium carbonation, mocha finish.

Pours a very dark chocolate brown, almost black color with very fain mahogany edges when held to a light source and a two finger frothy coffee colored head. Excellent retention, only sloly fading into a lasting cap that coats the glass with patches of soapy lacing.

Extremely smokey roasted malt aroma with hints of bitter dark chocolate, burnt toast, campfire, butane and BBQ bacon. This beer smells incredibly smokey but the roasted and sweeter chocolate malt notice are still present.

This beer is actually better balanced than I expected. I was expecting a complete smoke bomb but there was a nice sweet silky chocolate malt and lactic creamy presence to balance things out. This thing is still heavy on the smoke flavor with hints of burnt toast, roasted coffee/espresso bean, BBQ, bacon, charcoal, butane ans ash. Not acrid though! Theres also some slight caramel and hazelnut adding to the complexity and balance. The ABV is very well masked and in addition to the balanced flavors makes this beer dangerously drinkable. Dry smokey finish. Awesome and highly recommended!
2008 version. Pours a nice black with a thin tan head. Wonderful roasted scent with a hint of smoke and chocolate. Taste is the same with just a hint of booze. Very nice

Bottle, purchased at Marcus Foods in Whitefish, MT, shared with Cole. Pours black, with a creamy 1-finger pale tan head, very nice lacing. Nose is applewood smoke, combined with coffee, roast, bacon, jerky, very nice smoke character here. Flavours are beautifully meshed, both a fantastic Porter in its own respect, as well as a truly first-rate smoked beer. Smoak rises through layers of bitter dark fudgy chocolate, along with licorice, coffee, tar... Fantastic stuff. Easily the best beer Ive had from Left Hand.

Pours black with a very thick brown head. Looks great!! Aroma of roasted barley, some chocolate and delicate smoke. Flavour is great. Very strong and smokey in the flavour with bitter chocolate notes in the finish. This is an amazing smoked porter. It is really blowing my mind!!
Black with a lasting tan head. Aroma of licorice, chocolate and bacon with a phenolic note. Sweet licorice flavour with lots of smoke, and a touch of hot alcohol
Bottle. Pours a dark brown beer with a weak beige head. The aroma is malt, smoke, peat and caramel. The flavor is malt, smoke and peat. The palate is sweetness and smoke. Overall a good beer.

UPDATED: AUG 14, 2010 Pours black and shared with frosty.2008 bottle.  Tan/brown head fades to a film. Nose is smokey roast, sweet malts, and chocolate. Taste is more pronounced smoke roast and big sweet malts and some carmelization. Palate is smoothe and oily with no carbonation sting. Thesmoke is very pronounced in the flavor and finish not in a bad way. nice.

Bomber 2008 pours dark brown/black with small tan head. Aroma is strong campfire smoke with hints of molasses. Taste is like biting into a piece smoked sausage, molasses, slight roasted coffee. Nice balance, very enjoyable.
Pours black with a beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, smoke, chocolate and coffee. Flavour is roasted malt, smoke, alcohol, chocolate and coffee.
Bottle @ J.C.G US Tasting, Pt 3. Pours black with a creamy beige head and lacings. Nose is roast, chocolate and smoke. Flavor is salami and roasted dry coffee. Smooth and full bodied.

Bottle.

Black with a large, tan head.

Nice smokiness, salt, sweet, "bacon". Easy to drink. Aftertaste was nice and long. Quite complex and interesting.
Black with a small fluffy tan head.  Aroma and taste of leather, tobacco, and smoke with hints of licorice and eucalyptus.  Pretty good.

Bomber from Bubbles in KC in early May, just a touch of age on it.  Pours a "light" black with mahogany edges in the light and a big beige head with good retention and light lacing.  Aroma is lightly sweet caramel, oaky, and just a light touch of smoke.  Flavor is similar, with pronounced caramel sweetness and a very subtle smoky oak at the tail end.  Quite good, but not nearly as smoked as OFallon or the Alaskan I had just before.

Bottle (2008 vintage tasted May 2010).  Dark brown with a large, creamy brown head.  Sticky lacing.  The nose is sweet and malty at first with some hints of cocoa.  Then a smooth and rich campfire smokiness takes over.  Tastes rich in maltiness, roast, chocolate, and modestly bittersweet.  A dry, smokey background, but the molasses does a good job of balancing it out.  Gets drier as it warms.  Nice creamy mouthful.

A 2008 bottle split three ways in tulip glasses produced a finger worth of tan head that quickly left and settled to a thin lace. The body of the brew was the typical black porter color. 

A really nice smoked aroma came up from the glass. To say I got anything else from the aroma would be a stretch. The flavor was of Smoke as well but here is where this brew shines. You get a nice sweetness from the malts some chocolate and some light bit of dark fruit. It had a medium feel to my mouth with light carbonation.

It was one of the best smoked brews I have ever had. I do think the age helped this brew tremendously. I could have easily had another glass and for a smoked brew that says a lot for me

Serving type: bottle
solid black , tiny tan head, no lacing. powerful smell of smoke. tastes sweet, then strong smoked meat flavor, then melds to chocolate stout. medium body, low carbonation. Best smoke beer Ive had.

Pours deep black with tan head, aroma is some salty meat, ham, bacon, with some chocolate and campfire notes.  Taste is nice and meaty up front, balancing well with some salty pork, going into some bacon and chocolate flavors that ends smoky and ashy.  Usually not a fan, but like this one a lot!

Bottle.  Black pour with a huge light tan head on it, left chunks of lacing.  Meaty, smokey roasty aroma with light c hocolate notes.  Flavor has more smoke, char, and jerky notes as well as smooth chocolate and a little roasty coffee.  A nice smoked beer that I like almost as much as Alaskans take on the same style.

Bomber. Pours burgundy with a thin beige head. Smelled like smoked maple bacon, extremely powerful aroma. Taste was just like bacon and Liquid Smoke--not my thing. Finishes heavy and thick. I can see the appeal in the flavor, but its not for me.

Pours black with a thick beige colored head, very nice retention, lacing and carbonation. Aroma is of sweet barbecue, caramel, barley, not very smoky. Taste is of sweet smoked ham with a nice bitter barley and alcohol finish. Quite nice and not like any other smoked beer Ive had - its much sweeter.
Bottle; aroma of smoked meat, roasted malt, caramel, cocoa, leather.  Flavor was really nice.  Smoked malt, oats, meat, roasted malt, some caramel.  Really nice.  I have come along way.

Serving: 22 oz. bottle from Total Wine Sterling.
It pours a deep brownish black with ruby highlights.  The head is small, foamy, and dark tan in color.  Good head retention and nice lacing too.  The nose is full of roasted malt, some smoke, raisin, coffee, and barbecue.  The taste is rich and roasty but slightly oxidized.  Light barbecued ham notes, some paper, slight burnt notes, and fairly aggressive  hops.  The mouthfeel is rich and smooth with medium, very smooth carbonation.  The finish is long and very roasty.  Overall its a different take on a porter that brings it right to the edge of being a stout.  Decidedly rich, its not for the meek of heart.  But if you are a fan of big, rich beers, this one is sure to satisfy.
